institution.title: Institution Profile
institution.description: Basic information about your educational institution
institution.tooltip: Collect basic organizational information: name, type (university/school), size (students, employees, faculty), campus count, and contact details. This data helps categorize and benchmark against peer institutions.

itOrganization.title: IT Organization & Staffing
itOrganization.description: IT organizational structure and human resources
itOrganization.tooltip: Assess IT organizational structure using Operating Model framework. Includes: reporting structure (CIO/CTO), FTE allocation by function, organizational model (centralized/decentralized/federated), and outsourcing strategy based on COBIT framework.

itProcesses.title: IT Processes & ITSM Maturity
itProcesses.tooltip: Evaluate ITSM processes using ITIL 4 Framework. Covers: Service Desk (FCR, resolution time), Change Management, Project Management (Agile/Waterfall/Hybrid), and SDLC practices. Maturity rated from 1 (Initial) to 5 (Optimized).

applications.title: Applications Portfolio
applications.tooltip: Survey application portfolio using Application Portfolio Management. Core systems: SIS (Student Information System), LMS (Learning Management System), ERP, HRIS, CRM. Assess vendor, hosting model (on-premise/cloud/hybrid), and satisfaction levels.

processMapping.title: Process-System Mapping Matrix
processMapping.tooltip: Build Process-System Matrix using Enterprise Architecture principles. Map business processes to supporting systems (primary/supporting), identify integration gaps, and assess integration maturity (point-to-point â†’ ESB â†’ API-first).

dataAnalytics.title: Data & Analytics Capabilities
dataAnalytics.tooltip: Assess Data & Analytics capabilities using DAMA-DMBOK framework. Covers: Data Warehouse/Data Lake, BI tools, Data Governance maturity, Master Data Management. Evaluate from Descriptive â†’ Diagnostic â†’ Predictive â†’ Prescriptive analytics.

aiTechnology.title: AI & Emerging Technologies
aiTechnology.tooltip: Survey AI strategy using Gartner AI Maturity Model. Use cases: chatbot, grading automation, predictive analytics, personalized learning. Assess AI governance, ethical AI practices, and investment in emerging technologies.

infrastructure.title: Infrastructure & Cloud
infrastructure.tooltip: Evaluate Infrastructure using Cloud Maturity Model. Covers: Datacenter strategy, Cloud adoption (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS), multi-cloud approach, Network infrastructure (SD-WAN, Wi-Fi 6), virtualization, and Disaster Recovery capabilities.

security.title: Security & Compliance
security.tooltip: Assess Security Posture using NIST Cybersecurity Framework. Covers: Security framework adoption (ISO 27001/CIS), compliance (FERPA/GDPR), security tools (SIEM/EDR/IAM), MFA implementation, and security awareness training.

financial.title: IT Financial Analysis
financial.tooltip: Analyze IT Financial Management using TBM (Technology Business Management) framework. Covers: Total IT Budget, allocation by category (personnel/hardware/software/cloud), IT cost per student/employee, and CapEx vs OpEx ratio. Benchmark with EDUCAUSE data.

digitization.title: Process Digitization & Digital Maturity
digitization.tooltip: Assess Digital Maturity using CMM (Capability Maturity Model). Evaluate each process: Student Lifecycle, Academic Admin, Back Office. Maturity from 1 (Manual/Paper-based) to 5 (Fully Automated/AI-driven). Identify pain points and quick wins.

items: Fields marked with * are required for comprehensive analysis
All financial data should reflect the most recent completed fiscal year

Contact your project coordinator if you need clarification on any section

tooltips.itilMaturity: ITIL maturity level assesses IT service management capability. Level 1 (Initial): Ad-hoc, informal processes. Level 2 (Repeatable): Basic processes are repeated but not documented. Level 3 (Defined): Processes are documented and standardized. Level 4 (Managed): Processes are measured and controlled. Level 5 (Optimizing): Continuous improvement based on data.
tooltips.serviceDeskTool: The software/platform used to manage IT support tickets and service requests. Common examples: ServiceNow, Jira Service Management, BMC Remedy, Freshservice, Zendesk.
tooltips.monthlyTickets: The average total number of tickets/support requests received by the Service Desk each month. Includes both incidents and service requests. This helps assess workload and support demand.
tooltips.fcr: First Contact Resolution - The percentage of tickets resolved on the first contact without escalation or follow-up. High FCR (>70%) indicates capable support team and efficient processes. Formula: (First-contact resolved tickets / Total tickets) Ã— 100.
tooltips.resolutionTime: Average time (in hours) from ticket creation to complete resolution. Directly impacts user satisfaction and productivity. Benchmark: <4 hours (excellent), 4-24 hours (good), >24 hours (needs improvement).
tooltips.cabFrequency: Change Advisory Board (CAB) - A committee that meets regularly to review, evaluate, and approve significant IT system changes. Meeting frequency reflects change control maturity and deployment velocity.
tooltips.changeSuccessRate: The percentage of changes deployed successfully without causing incidents or requiring rollback. High rate (>95%) indicates effective change management. Formula: (Successful changes / Total changes) Ã— 100.
tooltips.assetTool: Software used to track, manage, and inventory IT assets (hardware, software, licenses). Examples: ServiceNow ITAM, Lansweeper, Snow Software, Flexera. Good tools help optimize costs and ensure license compliance.
tooltips.cmdbAccuracy: Configuration Management Database (CMDB) - The percentage of configuration data in the CMDB that is accurate and up-to-date. Accurate CMDB (>85%) is fundamental for effective incident, change, and problem management. Measured by comparing CMDB data against reality through periodic audits.

applications.title: Applications Portfolio & Systems Landscape
applications.description: Map all core enterprise systems and their integration points across your institution

processMapping.title: Process-System Mapping Matrix
processMapping.description: Map which systems support each critical business process in your institution

integrationGaps.title: Critical Integration Gaps
integrationGaps.sisLms: SIS â†” LMS (Course roster sync issues)
integrationGaps.biAll: BI â†” All Systems (Data warehouse ETL issues)

tooltips.primarySystem: The main system responsible for processing and storing data for this process. Examples: SIS for course registration, CRM for recruitment, LMS for course delivery.
tooltips.supportingSystems: Secondary systems that integrate with the primary system to support the process. May include APIs, Portals, BI reporting systems, or automation tools.
tooltips.dataFlow: Describes how data flows between systems. Example: 'Web Form â†’ CRM â†’ SIS â†’ LMS' shows where data moves from and to across systems.
tooltips.integrationChallenges: Describe specific integration challenges such as: manual data entry, delayed data sync, data quality issues, missing APIs, or process bottlenecks.
tooltips.integrationGaps: Critical integration gaps that impact operational efficiency. Check all integration issues currently existing in your organization.
tooltips.maturityLevel: Integration maturity level assesses system integration architecture. Level 1: Manual, Point-to-Point. Level 2: Basic scripts and batch processing. Level 3: Centralized Middleware/Integration Hub. Level 4: Enterprise Integration Platform (ESB, iPaaS). Level 5: Real-time Event-Driven architecture with API Gateway.
tooltips.activeIntegrations: Total number of active integration connections between systems (APIs, ETL, webhooks, file transfers, etc.). This reflects the complexity of the IT ecosystem.

tooltips.dataWarehouse: A centralized data storage platform optimized for analytics and reporting. Examples: Snowflake, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, Azure Synapse, Oracle, Teradata. Data warehouses aggregate data from multiple sources for analysis.
tooltips.biTool: Business Intelligence - Data analysis and visualization tools for creating reports and dashboards. Common examples: Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, Looker. BI tools transform raw data into actionable insights.
tooltips.dataGovernance: Data governance framework defines policies, standards, and processes for managing data across the organization. Includes: data ownership, data quality, data security, and metadata management.
tooltips.dataLake: A repository storing raw data in its native format (structured, semi-structured, unstructured) for advanced analytics and machine learning. Examples: AWS S3, Azure Data Lake, Google Cloud Storage. Unlike data warehouses, data lakes store unprocessed data.
tooltips.masterData: Master Data Management (MDM) - Processes and tools to create and maintain consistent master data (Student, Employee, Course, Vendor). MDM ensures 'single source of truth' for critical entities across the organization.
tooltips.dataQualityScore: Overall data quality assessment from 1-5 based on: Accuracy, Completeness, Consistency, Timeliness, and Validity. 1=Very Poor, 2=Poor, 3=Average, 4=Good, 5=Excellent.

tooltips.aiStrategy: Organization's AI strategy status. No strategy: No AI plans yet. Exploring: Investigating AI opportunities. Developing: Building AI strategy. Implemented: Strategy deployed. Mature: Established AI program with multiple production use cases.
tooltips.aiSpending: Total annual AI/ML spending including: cloud AI platforms, software licenses, training data, and AI personnel (if tracked separately). Excludes general IT costs counted elsewhere.
tooltips.aiPlatforms: AI/ML platforms in use. Cloud: Azure AI, AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI. APIs: OpenAI, Anthropic, Cohere. Open-source: Hugging Face, LangChain. Enterprise: IBM Watson, Salesforce Einstein.
tooltips.aiGovernance: AI governance framework ensuring responsible and ethical AI use. Includes: AI policies, risk assessment, bias detection, transparency, and regulatory compliance (EU AI Act, etc.).
tooltips.aiUseCases: AI use cases deployed or planned. Chatbots: Student/staff support. Predictive: Retention prediction, grade forecasting. Automation: Administrative process automation, automated grading.
tooltips.aiInitiatives: Describe current AI initiatives, challenges faced (data, talent, budget, culture), and future plans. This information helps assess the organization's AI readiness.

tooltips.datacenterStrategy: Datacenter strategy defines how the organization deploys and manages infrastructure. On-premise: Internal datacenter. Colocation: Rented space at external datacenter. Cloud-first: Prioritize cloud for new workloads. Hybrid: Combined on-premise and cloud. Cloud-only: Fully cloud-based.
tooltips.cloudProviders: Cloud service providers in use. AWS (Amazon), Azure (Microsoft), GCP (Google), OCI (Oracle), IBM Cloud. Multi-cloud can avoid vendor lock-in and optimize costs.
tooltips.cloudSpend: Total annual cloud spending including: compute, storage, networking, database, and managed services. Excludes software license costs running on cloud.
tooltips.workloadPercent: Percentage of workloads/applications running on cloud vs. total. 0-25%: Early adopter. 25-50%: Hybrid. 50-75%: Cloud-preferred. >75%: Cloud-native.
tooltips.networkVendor: Core network equipment vendor (switches, routers, firewalls). Examples: Cisco, Juniper, Arista, HPE/Aruba, Fortinet. Usually one primary vendor for simplified management.
tooltips.bandwidth: Total organization Internet bandwidth (Gbps). Includes primary and backup links. Benchmark: 1-10 Gbps for mid-size, 10-100 Gbps for large organizations.
tooltips.wifi: Wi-Fi standard deployed on campus. Wi-Fi 6E (802.11ax 6GHz): Latest, highest speed. Wi-Fi 6 (802.11ax): High performance. Wi-Fi 5 (802.11ac): Common. Mixed: Multiple standards combined.
tooltips.sdwan: Software-Defined WAN - Technology for managing wide area networks via software, optimizing routing, security, and performance between sites. Reduces MPLS costs, increases flexibility.
tooltips.virtualization: Server virtualization platform for running virtual machines (VMs). Examples: VMware vSphere, Microsoft Hyper-V, KVM, Nutanix AHV, Proxmox. Enables optimal hardware resource utilization.
tooltips.backup: Data and system backup solution. Examples: Veeam, Commvault, Rubrik, Cohesity, Veritas NetBackup. Follow 3-2-1 backup: 3 copies, 2 media types, 1 offsite.
tooltips.drSite: Disaster Recovery Site - Location for disaster recovery. Can be secondary datacenter, cloud DR (Azure Site Recovery, AWS DRS), or colocation. RTO/RPO depends on business requirements.

tooltips.framework: Standard security framework adopted for managing cybersecurity risk. NIST: Popular US standard. ISO 27001: International standard. CIS Controls: 18 prioritized controls. Custom: Self-built framework from multiple sources.
tooltips.reporting: Reporting structure for security leadership (CISO). Reporting to CIO is most common. Reporting to CEO/President indicates high security priority. Reporting to CFO often relates to compliance focus.
tooltips.compliance: Mandatory or voluntary compliance standards. FERPA: Student data protection (US). GDPR: Personal data protection (EU). HIPAA: Healthcare data. PCI-DSS: Card payments. SOC 2: Service controls.
tooltips.endpoint: Endpoint protection solution for devices (laptops, desktops, mobile). Modern EDR/XDR like CrowdStrike, SentinelOne, Microsoft Defender. Traditional antivirus is insufficient for current threats.
tooltips.siem: Security Information & Event Management - Collects and analyzes security logs from multiple sources to detect threats. Examples: Splunk, Microsoft Sentinel, IBM QRadar. SIEM is the core of Security Operations Center (SOC).
tooltips.iam: Identity & Access Management - Manages identity and access rights. Includes SSO (Single Sign-On), MFA, Privileged Access Management. Examples: Okta, Azure AD, Duo, Ping Identity.
tooltips.firewall: Next-generation firewall (NGFW) protecting the network with application detection, IPS, and URL filtering. Examples: Palo Alto, Fortinet, Check Point, Cisco Firepower.
tooltips.mfa: Multi-Factor Authentication - Enhances security with multiple verification factors. Universal: All users. Staff only: Employees only. Selective: Critical systems. MFA significantly reduces credential theft risk.
tooltips.training: Security awareness training program for users. Includes phishing simulation, password hygiene, social engineering awareness. Regular training reduces risk from human error.
tooltips.lastAudit: Date of most recent security audit by third party or internal. Audits should be conducted annually. Includes penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, compliance audit.
tooltips.incidents: Number of major security incidents in the last 12 months. Includes: ransomware, data breach, successful phishing, unauthorized access. This number helps evaluate security program effectiveness.

financial.title: IT Financial Data
financial.note: All financial data should be for the most recent completed fiscal year

metrics.title: Additional Financial Metrics
metrics.budgetPercent: IT Budget as % of Total Institution Budget

tooltips.totalBudget: Total annual IT budget including all costs: personnel, hardware, software, cloud, services, projects. Does not include shadow IT in other departments. Benchmark: 3-6% of total organizational budget.
tooltips.breakdown: Budget allocation by category helps analyze cost structure. Can enter absolute values (USD) or percentages (%). Total categories should equal 100% or total budget.
tooltips.personnel: IT personnel costs including: salary, benefits, insurance, and contractor/consultant costs. Typically 30-50% of IT budget. EDUCAUSE benchmark: ~38%.
tooltips.hardware: Hardware costs including: servers, storage, networking equipment, and end-user devices (laptops, desktops, mobile). Trend declining as organizations move to cloud.
tooltips.software: Software license costs including: enterprise applications (ERP, SIS, LMS), productivity tools (Microsoft 365), and specialized software. Trend increasing with SaaS model.
tooltips.cloud: Cloud service costs including IaaS (compute, storage), PaaS (database, AI services), and SaaS (applications). Rapidly growing trend in education.
tooltips.budgetPercent: IT budget ratio compared to total organizational budget. Education benchmark: 3-6%. Higher Education: 4-7%. Low ratio may indicate insufficient IT investment.
tooltips.costPerStudent: Average IT cost per student. Formula: Total IT budget / Total students. EDUCAUSE benchmark: $500-$1,200/student depending on institution type.
tooltips.costPerEmployee: Average IT cost per employee. Formula: Total IT budget / Total employees. Benchmark: $3,000-$5,000/employee. Reflects investment in productivity.
tooltips.capexOpex: Ratio of Capital Expenditure (asset purchases) vs Operational Expenditure (operating costs). Trend shifting from CapEx to OpEx with cloud and SaaS. Benchmark: 30/70 to 20/80.

digitization.title: Process Digitization & Digital Maturity Assessment
digitization.description: Rate your institution's digital maturity across key dimensions (1 = Initial/Manual, 5 = Optimized/Automated)
digitization.painPoints: Key Pain Points & Quick Win Opportunities

tooltips.admissions: Rate digitization level of admissions process: Application processing, CRM for prospect tracking, automated communications, application evaluation. 1=Fully manual, 5=Fully automated and integrated.
tooltips.enrollment: Rate enrollment and registration process: Online course registration, electronic payment processing, automated approvals. 1=Paper-based manual, 5=Complete self-service.
tooltips.academic: Rate academic operations: Grade management, electronic transcripts, automated scheduling, learning progress tracking. 1=Paper gradebooks, 5=Real-time analytics.
tooltips.studentServices: Rate student services: Online academic advising, financial aid support, career services, ticketing system. 1=Walk-in only, 5=Omnichannel support.
tooltips.alumni: Rate alumni relations: Alumni database, fundraising campaigns, event management, networking platform. 1=No system, 5=Integrated engagement platform.
tooltips.curriculum: Rate curriculum management: Program design, approval workflow, syllabus management, learning outcomes. 1=Word/Excel, 5=Curriculum management system.
tooltips.quality: Rate quality assurance: Accreditation processes, feedback collection, assessment tracking, compliance reporting. 1=Manual, 5=Continuous quality monitoring.
tooltips.library: Rate library services: Digital resources, lending system, online research, interlibrary loan. 1=Traditional library, 5=Digital library services.
tooltips.research: Rate research administration: Grant management, research data, publication tracking, collaboration tools. 1=No system, 5=Research information system.
tooltips.finance: Rate finance & accounting: Financial ERP, budget management, accounts payable/receivable, financial reporting. 1=Manual bookkeeping, 5=Real-time financial analytics.
tooltips.hr: Rate HR processes: Online recruiting, digital onboarding, payroll management, performance evaluation. 1=Paper files, 5=HCM cloud platform.
tooltips.procurement: Rate procurement: E-procurement, vendor management, PO automation, contract lifecycle. 1=Manual, 5=Procurement analytics.
tooltips.facilities: Rate facilities management: Space management, work order system, asset tracking, sustainability monitoring. 1=No system, 5=Smart building platform.
tooltips.processDigitization: Composite score rating business process digitization level. Calculate average of individual ratings. 1.0-2.0: Urgent improvement needed. 3.0-4.0: Developing. 4.0-5.0: Advanced.
tooltips.dataMaturity: Score rating data and analytics maturity level. Includes: data governance, data quality, analytics capability, data-driven decisions. 1=Ad-hoc, 5=Predictive/Prescriptive.
tooltips.itOperations: Score rating IT operations maturity level. Includes: service management, automation, monitoring, incident response. 1=Reactive, 5=AIOps & full automation.
tooltips.painPoints: Describe key pain points in current processes and quick win opportunities. Quick wins: Fast improvements, low cost, high impact. Helps prioritize transformation roadmap.
